contentrichtext.text: {{italictitle}} {{Taxobox | name = ''Quaesitosaurus'' | fossil_range = [[Late Cretaceous]] | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Chordate|Chordata]] | classis = [[Reptile|Sauropsida]] | superordo = [[Dinosaur]]ia | ordo = [[Saurischia]] | subordo = [[Sauropodomorpha]] | infraordo = [[Sauropoda]] | superfamilia = [[Titanosaur]]oidea | familia = [[Nemegtosauridae]] | genus = '''''Quaesitosaurus''''' | genus_authority= Kurzanov & Bannikov, 1983 |subdivision_ranks=[[Species]] |subdivision= *''Q. orientalis'' <small>Kurzanov & Bannikov, 1983 ([[type species|type]])</small> }} '''''Quaesitosaurus''''' (meaning "extraordinary lizard") is a [[genus]] of [[titanosaur]]ian [[sauropod]] found by Kurzanov and Bannikov in 1983. The [[type species]] is ''Quaesitosaurus orientalis''. It lived from 85 to 70 [[million years ago]] during the [[Late Cretaceous]] ([[Santonian]] to [[Campanian]] ages). Its fossils, consisting solely of a partial skull, were found in the [[Barun Goyot Formation]] near Shar Tsav, [[Mongolia]]. Long, low and horse-like with frontally located peg-teeth, it is similar enough to the skulls of ''Diplodocus'' and its kin to have prompted informed speculation that the missing body was formed like those of diplodocids. It is possible that ''Nemegtosaurus'', also known from only skull material, is a very close relative of ''Quaesitosaurus'', if not indeed a variation of the same animal. ==References== * Hunt, A.P., Meyer, C.A., Lockley, M.G., and Lucas, S.G. (1994) "Archaeology, toothmarks and sauropod dinosaur taphonomy". ''Gaia: Revista de Geociencias'', Museu Nacional de Historia Natural, Lisbon, Portugal, 10: 225-232. * Kurzanov, S. and Bannikov, A. (1983). "A new sauropod from the Upper Cretaceous of Mongolia". ''Paleontologicheskii Zhurnal'' 2: 90-96. ==External links== *[http://www.thescelosaurus.com/saltasauridae.htm Saltasauridae] from ''Thescelosaurus''! (scroll down) *[http://www.dinodata.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=7304&Itemid=67 ''Quaesitosaurus''] from DinoData.org (technical) {{Portal|Dinosaurs}} [[Category:Cretaceous dinosaurs]] [[Category:Dinosaurs of Asia]] [[Category:Titanosaurs]] [[Category:Sauropods]] {{Sauropodomorph-stub}}
